page.title: 13OLD BUILDINGS IN LOWDHAM.
page.content: St. Mary's Church __________________ The church is very old.The tower dates back to the twelfth century.The spire dates from the fifteenth century.It was ,however, so heavy it caused the tower to crack and two supporting buttresses had to be built in the nineteenth century.The thirteenth century font is one of the best examples in the county.It is octagonal with decorated gables. Lowdham Water Mill __________________ The water mill is a three-storey brick mill flanked by smaller buildings.It is now a private house. The Manor House _______________ The house was built in the seventeenth century.Under the plaster it has a timber frame.
